abstract: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, said Wednesday in a letter to investors that although the business community was being “demonized,” the United States needed large banks.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, said Wednesday in a letter to investors that although the business community was being “demonized,” the United States needed large banks.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, said Wednesday in a letter to investors that although the business community was being “demonized,” the United States needed large banks.

headline.main: Dimon Defends Bank Size Against Critics
